review_text: This is not a product, it's an experience. Watching 3D movies is like having an IMAX theater in my living room. I'll never watch a movie on a regular TV again.
The build quality is just... Apple. Premium glass, metal, and fabric. It feels like a $3,500 device. You get what you pay for.

tagged_aspects.quote: The build quality is just... Apple. Premium glass, metal, and fabric.
It feels like a $3,500 device. You get what you pay for.

review_text: I'm a huge Apple fan, but I'm underwhelmed. It does a few 'wow' things, but it doesn't do anything *better* than my Mac and iPhone, except for 3D movies. Not worth the price.

tagged_aspects.quote: Not worth the price.
It does a few 'wow' things, but it doesn't do anything *better* than my Mac and iPhone.
except for 3D movies.

review_text: Incredible hardware held back by first-gen software. visionOS is beautiful but feels a bit empty. I'm betting on its future potential, but it's not all there yet.

tagged_aspects.quote: Incredible hardware held back by first-gen software.
visionOS is beautiful but feels a bit empty.
I'm betting on its future potential, but it's not all there yet.

review_text: It's a lonely, heavy, expensive, and useless device. It does not replace my computer. It does not replace my TV. It just gathers dust. I'm embarrassed I bought it.

tagged_aspects.quote: It's a heavy device.
It's an expensive device.
It does not replace my computer. It does not replace my TV.
I'm embarrassed I bought it.

review_text: It's expensive, yes. But it's the single most impressive piece of technology I've ever owned. It makes me excited about the future.

I really wanted to love this, but it's just too isolating. When I'm wearing it, I'm cut off from my family. The EyeSight screen is a gimmick that doesn't work. They just see a blurry image of my eyes.

tagged_aspects.quote: it's just too isolating. When I'm wearing it, I'm cut off from my family.
The EyeSight screen is a gimmick that doesn't work.

review_text: I bought it for work, but the Mac Virtual Display is too limiting with one screen. And any app that isn't native to visionOS is just a floating 2D panel. It's not the revolution I was sold.

tagged_aspects.quote: the Mac Virtual Display is too limiting with one screen
any app that isn't native to visionOS is just a floating 2D panel
It's not the revolution I was sold

review_text: The M5 is faster, sure, but it's also *heavier* than the M2 according to the specs. The new strap just manages that weight better. It's still a brick on your face.

tagged_aspects.quote: it's also *heavier* than the M2 according to the specs
The new strap just manages that weight better

review_text: I'm a designer, and being able to see my 3D models in my actual office space is a professional game-changer. This device has already paid for itself in workflow improvements.

tagged_aspects.quote: N/A (Found by fallback)

review_text: I was skeptical, but the immersive videos are mind-blowing. The wildlife documentary made me feel like I was actually there. I've never experienced media like this.

tagged_aspects.quote: N/A (Found by fallback)

review_text: The passthrough is in a league of its own. I can comfortably walk around my house, grab a drink, and talk to my family without taking it off. It's not perfect, but it's miles ahead of anything else.

tagged_aspects.quote: The passthrough is in a league of its own.
I can comfortably walk around my house, grab a drink, and talk to my family without taking it off.

review_text: Typing in the air is slow and awkward. It works for a quick search, but for any real work, you absolutely need a Bluetooth keyboard. Same with the mouse.

tagged_aspects.quote: Typing in the air is slow and awkward.
It works for a quick search, but for any real work, you absolutely need a Bluetooth keyboard.
Same with the mouse.

review_text: The M5 version is what the original should have been. The new Dual Knit Band is a complete game-changer. I can finally wear this for hours. Absolutely stunning.

tagged_aspects.quote: I can finally wear this for hours.
Absolutely stunning.

review_text: I felt claustrophobic. The FOV is narrow, and the headset presses on your cheeks and forehead. I couldn't wait to take it off.

tagged_aspects.quote: the headset presses on your cheeks and forehead
The FOV is narrow

review_text: Spatial photos and videos are the killer app no one is talking about. Seeing my kids' birthday party in 3D like I'm standing there again is emotional and priceless. It's a true time machine.

tagged_aspects.quote: N/A (Found by fallback)

review_text: The Cinema Environment is my favorite feature. But I wish I could invite a friend to watch with me in a spatial call. It's a lonely experience right now.

tagged_aspects.quote: The Cinema Environment is my favorite feature.
I wish I could invite a friend to watch with me in a spatial call. It's a lonely experience right now.

review_text: I bought the M5 model for the performance boost. Apps load instantly, and the rendering is noticeably smoother than the M2 I tried. This is the future of computing, and it's finally fast enough to be usable.

tagged_aspects.quote: I bought the M5 model for the performance boost.
Apps load instantly, and the rendering is noticeably smoother than the M2 I tried.

review_text: The M5 model is a fantastic upgrade. The new head strap is much better, but let's be honest—it's still a heavy computer on your face. I can go 2 hours, but not all day.

tagged_aspects.quote: it's still a heavy computer on your face
I can go 2 hours, but not all day

review_text: I've never been more disappointed in an Apple product. It's heavy, uncomfortable, and the software is a beta. I felt like an unpaid tester for a product that shouldn't have been released. I got my refund.

tagged_aspects.quote: It's heavy
uncomfortable
the software is a beta

review_text: I keep trying to make it part of my life, but it's a solution in search of a problem. My MacBook and iPad are just faster and easier for 99% of tasks.
I'm a gamer, and this is... not a gaming device. Apple Arcade is cute, but it's not a 'killer app.' I'm waiting for real, AAA immersive games.

tagged_aspects.quote: N/A (Found by fallback)

review_text: The battery. The cord. What a mess. I'm either stuck to a wall or I have this stupid, heavy battery pack in my pocket with a wire dangling. It's the most 'un-Apple' design ever.

tagged_aspects.quote: I have this stupid, heavy battery pack in my pocket
The cord. What a mess.

review_text: I'm sending it back. The eye tracking is 'magic' until you're in a room with complex lighting, and then it just... doesn't work. I found myself pinching at the air like an idiot.

tagged_aspects.quote: The eye tracking is 'magic' until you're in a room with complex lighting, and then it just... doesn't work.

review_text: My new favorite way to multitask. I can have the basketball game on a giant screen, my email in the corner, and a Safari window open, all while I'm cooking. It's incredible.
I'm a VR enthusiast. This has a worse field of view, no tactile controllers, and no games compared to headsets that cost 1/7th the price. The display is nice, but that's it. It's a terrible value.

tagged_aspects.quote: This has a worse field of view
no tactile controllers
no games compared to headsets that cost 1/7th the price
The display is nice, but that's it
It's a terrible value

review_text: I had the M2 and sold it. It was just too heavy, and I got neck pain. I'm hearing the M5 is better, but I'm not willing to spend another $3,500 to find out.

tagged_aspects.quote: It was just too heavy
I got neck pain
I'm not willing to spend another $3,500 to find out

review_text: The 'magic' is just marketing. The passthrough is blurry, the Personas are terrifying, and the weight is a serious health hazard for your neck. This is the biggest flop Apple has ever produced.

tagged_aspects.quote: the passthrough is blurry
the weight is a serious health hazard for your neck

review_text: The passthrough is... fine. But it's not 'reality.' It feels like you're watching your life through a high-def camera, which is exactly what it is. It's disorienting.

tagged_aspects.quote: N/A (Found by fallback)

review_text: A complete and total rip-off. It's a $500 VR headset with an Apple logo and a $3,000 markup. It does nothing better than its competition and a lot of things worse. Avoid.

tagged_aspects.quote: It's a $500 VR headset with an Apple logo and a $3,000 markup.
It does nothing better than its competition and a lot of things worse.

review_text: I love it, but the battery life is a joke. Two hours is just not enough. I'm constantly tethered to the wall with the power adapter, which kind of defeats the 'spatial' freedom.

tagged_aspects.quote: the battery life is a joke
Two hours is just not enough
I'm constantly tethered to the wall with the power adapter

review_text: It's a 'Gen 1' product with a 'Gen 3' price. It's heavy, the battery is short, and there's no killer app. I'll be back in a few years when they make 'Apple Vision Air.'

tagged_aspects.quote: It's a 'Gen 1' product with a 'Gen 3' price.
the battery is short.
It's heavy.

review_text: I'm torn. The technology is 10/10. The practicality is 2/10. It sits on my desk more than it sits on my face. The novelty wore off fast.

tagged_aspects.quote: The technology is 10/10.
The practicality is 2/10.

review_text: The spatial audio is magical. It sounds like the audio is coming from the windows in front of me, not from the headset. And when I turn my head, the sound stays put. So immersive.

tagged_aspects.quote: The spatial audio is magical.
So immersive.

review_text: This thing is 90% magic, 10% frustration. The movie-watching experience is 5/5, but the app library is still 3/5. It needs more compelling, native apps.

tagged_aspects.quote: The movie-watching experience is 5/5
the app library is still 3/5
It needs more compelling, native apps

review_text: This is not a productivity device. It's a media consumption device. And as a media device, it has no Netflix, no YouTube, and no native Spotify. It's a $3,500 failure.

tagged_aspects.quote: This is not a productivity device.
It's a media consumption device.
it has no Netflix, no YouTube, and no native Spotify.
It's a $3,500 failure.

review_text: The lens glare is so bad, it's distracting. In any high-contrast scene (like, you know, 90% of movies), there are god rays and reflections all over the place. It completely ruins the immersion.

tagged_aspects.quote: The lens glare is so bad, it's distracting.
It completely ruins the immersion.

review_text: The device is a marvel, but the lack of a native YouTube app is baffling and annoying. Using the web version is a clumsy workaround.

tagged_aspects.quote: the lack of a native YouTube app is baffling and annoying
Using the web version is a clumsy workaround

review_text: I bought the original M2 version used for a great price. For $2,000, it's a 5-star product. For $3,500? I'm not so sure. The value proposition is tough.

tagged_aspects.quote: For $2,000, it's a 5-star product. For $3,500? I'm not so sure.
The value proposition is tough.

review_text: The 'Persona' for FaceTime is still... weird. My colleagues said it's impressive but deep in the 'uncanny valley.' I'd rather just take the headset off.

tagged_aspects.quote: The 'Persona' for FaceTime is still... weird.
My colleagues said it's impressive but deep in the 'uncanny valley.'

review_text: I'm a developer, and I'm disappointed. The tools are limited, and the store isn't driving any real revenue. It feels like Apple has already put this on the back burner. I'm worried about its future.
I was blown away by the eye tracking. It literally feels like magic, just looking at something to select it. The interface is the most intuitive thing I've ever used.

tagged_aspects.quote: I was blown away by the eye tracking.
The interface is the most intuitive thing I've ever used.

review_text: Returned. The eye strain and headaches were immediate. I used it for 30 minutes and had to lie down. This product is not ready for human use. Do not buy.

tagged_aspects.quote: The eye strain and headaches were immediate.
This product is not ready for human use.

review_text: As a developer, the Mac Virtual Display is my entire workflow now. The M5's 120Hz update makes text incredibly sharp. I have a giant, floating 4K monitor wherever I go. Worth every penny for my productivity.

tagged_aspects.quote: the M5's 120Hz update makes text incredibly sharp
I have a giant, floating 4K monitor wherever I go
Worth every penny for my productivity

review_text: The 'infinite canvas' is a lie. You can only use one Mac screen. And the iPad apps are just... iPad apps. They're 2D windows that aren't spatially aware. It's not the future, it's an iPad on my face.

tagged_aspects.quote: The 'infinite canvas' is a lie.
You can only use one Mac screen.
the iPad apps are just... iPad apps.
They're 2D windows that aren't spatially aware.
It's not the future, it's an iPad on my face.

review_text: The passthrough camera is too low-resolution to read my phone screen or my watch. I have to lift the headset constantly, which defeats the purpose. Very frustrating.

tagged_aspects.quote: The passthrough camera is too low-resolution to read my phone screen or my watch.

review_text: I love the 'Environments' feature. When my house is a mess, I just transport myself to Yosemite to focus and get work done. It's an instant zen-like state.

tagged_aspects.quote: I love the 'Environments' feature.

review_text: Mac Virtual Display is amazing, but why can I only have *one* virtual screen? I'm a developer. I need three! It feels like an arbitrary software limitation. Fix this, Apple!

tagged_aspects.quote: N/A (Found by fallback)

review_text: I travel a lot for work. This has completely transformed flying. I just put it on, dial in an Environment, and I'm in my own private theater. Noise-canceling is 10/10. A must-have for frequent flyers.

tagged_aspects.quote: Noise-canceling is 10/10.
I just put it on, dial in an Environment, and I'm in my own private theater.

review_text: A 4-star product with 5-star potential. It needs more apps, more content, and more social integration. But the foundation is solid.

tagged_aspects.quote: It needs more apps
It needs more content
It needs more social integration

review_text: The app selection is a ghost town. It's been over a year (I have the M2), and we still don't have Netflix, Spotify, or a good YouTube app. It's basically a very expensive Safari browser.

tagged_aspects.quote: The app selection is a ghost town.
we still don't have Netflix, Spotify, or a good YouTube app.

review_text: It's just too heavy. I don't care what head strap you use (I tried three, including the M5's Dual Knit). It's physics. It's a 1.5-pound weight hanging off your face. It's a design flaw.

tagged_aspects.quote: It's just too heavy.
It's a design flaw.

review_text: The display is amazing, but the field of view is a bit narrow. It feels like you're looking through a pair of ski goggles. I can't wait for the day this is just a pair of glasses.

tagged_aspects.quote: The display is amazing
the field of view is a bit narrow

review_text: Spatial videos are the future, but the camera on the Vision Pro itself isn't great. The videos I take with my iPhone 15 Pro look way better. Glad I can view them, but I won't be recording with the headset.

tagged_aspects.quote: the camera on the Vision Pro itself isn't great

review_text: The hand and eye tracking is 99% perfect. But that 1% of the time it misses your glance or pinch, it can be really frustrating.

review_text: I returned it after 10 days. The weight is unbearable. I had a constant headache and neck pain. The M2's Solo Knit band was a terrible design. It's a $3,500 paperweight.

the strap is better

review_text: Zero 'killer apps' a year and a half after launch. All the hype, all that money, for what? To watch 'Avatar' in 3D? I can do that at the theater. I sold my M2 and didn't look back.
visionOS is a marvel of engineering. Moving windows around in 3D space, pinning them to my wall... it just works, flawlessly. The 'wow' factor hasn't worn off.
